p:
If B is the number of boundary nodes of the community, then the expected number of infections, for an individual with s infectious out of k total contacts, is simply λ( s, k) B. If we do not consider the local awareness and the outside world is completely infected we can simplify λ( s, k) to
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} $$1 - {[1 - {e}^{-H}\tau ]}^{{k}^{out} }$$ \end{document} and we obtain
